introduction.p: If P is a square matrix, write \uvec{p}_1, \uvec{p}_2, \dotsc, \uvec{p}_n for the columns of P, so that P = \begin{bmatrix} \uvec{p}_1 \amp \uvec{p}_2 \amp \cdots \amp \uvec{p}_n \end{bmatrix} .

For this discovery guide, we will need to recall a few important things.
An n \times n matrix is invertible if and only if its columns form a basis of \R^n ().
Similarity relation \inv{P} A P = B holds if and only if each column of B consists of coefficients for expressing the corresponding transformed vector A \uvec{p}_j as a linear combination of the columns of P ().
Vector \uvec{x} in \R^n is an eigenvector of A if A\uvec{x} = \lambda \uvec{x}. Equivalently, \uvec{x} is an eigenvector of A if (\lambda I - A) \uvec{x} = \uvec{0}.
Suppose A is a 3\times 3 matrix with characteristic polynomial c_A(\lambda) = (\lambda - 5)^3 .

task.p: What are the eigenvalues of A? What are the algebraic multiplicities of its eigenvalues?

prelude.p: The collection of vectors that are in the null space of (\lambda I - A)^k for at least one positive exponent k is called the generalized eigenspace of A for the eigenvalue \lambda, and is denoted G_{\lambda}(A).

statement.p: Suppose A is an n \times n matrix and \lambda is an eigenvalue of A.

Use the Subspace Test
to verify that G_{\lambda}(A) is a subspace of \R^n.
Careful: When you check closure under addition, you cannot assume that both arbitrary vectors from G_{\lambda}(A) are in the null space of the same power of (\lambda I - A).

introduction.p:
It is quite easy to switch between upper and lower triangular forms. Consider the transition matrix
J = \begin{bmatrix} \amp \amp \amp \amp 1 \\ \amp \amp \amp \iddots \\ \amp \amp 1 \\ \amp 1 \\ 1 \end{bmatrix} .

task.p: Verify that \inv{J} = J.
Use the pattern of similarity described in the introduction of this discovery guide to show that if U is an upper triangular matrix of the same size as J, then \inv{J}UJ is lower triangular.

statement.p: Show that if L is a lower triangular matrix of the same size as J, then \inv{J}LJ is upper triangular.
